review.itemreviewed: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket a month ago and couldn’t be more happy. It’s the perfect shoulder season jacket, the material is quality, the fit is perfect, I’m 5’11 175 with an athletic build. I’ve tried alot of other similar jackets from different Euro brands and I always ran into the same issue, the jacket was always narrow at the top by shoulders and Lats. This jacket does not have that issue, but is still slim fitting at the same time. I love the look of it as well, it’s a very technical piece yet looks sharp when wearing it out around town.
review.name: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: great when guiding on glaciers and can withstand a quick storm. fits so nice, soft and stretchy. feels great under harness and the zipper is crisp. no vents but fairly lightweight.
review.name: softshell jacket

review.itemreviewed: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use it as more sturdy wind breaker for multipitch trad climbing. Love the fabric and the elastic cuff that i can pull out of the way when im crack climbing. Its the main reason why i bought this one instead of the Arcteryx gamma.
review.name: Great softshell!

review.itemreviewed: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Definitely a jacket for specific shoulder season weather: colder, semi-dry days. It's a warm jacket that sadly doesn't have pit zips to let heat out when the hiking/climbing gets going. I had to fully unzip the front and leave it open. Wouldn't use it as a rain jacket. Could be used as a light snow jacket. I've been using it as a springtime (and fall) belay jacket and it works great. If you get caught in a drizzle the repellancy works shedding water and wind. Love the soft, stretch fabric that doesn't restrict moment and allows me to wear just a t-shirt underneath if need be. Big pockets all with good zippers and it packs into its own pocket. The hand cuffs are interesting and remind me of cycling jackets that are longer on top to keep water off the  back your hands. It has stretch band cuff on the underside along wrist. So far i haven't had issue with them, but i worry the elastic will one day no longer be tight and the cuff could be baggy and useless. Maybe they should have stuck with classic Velcro straps to adjust cuff tightness--only time will tell. Overall i like the jacket as my backup for when i don't expect bad weather but need something just in case. A great jacket for walking around town too.
review.name: A Softie for Shoulder Season Days

name: Chockstone Alpine LT Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: We ordered these for our 15 month old. In less than a month (July 31 (date of delivery) to August 30), the stitching holding the blue leather and velcro together on the straps on both shoes is coming undone quite a lot. Our son maybe wears these two to three hours a week and is not putting hard miles on these by any means. They still look awesome, but the quality is pitiful.
review.name: Falling Apart
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience with us, this is not something we like to see. Please check out our warranty information by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking warranty.

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Very poor quality. My son wore them for just one day, and they already started falling apart. I don’t recommend buying these.
review.name: Bad quality
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seems like a good quality shoe, but we have to wait and use it as it runs a little large. But we are keeping it because we are happy with quality of the shoe and that it's more on the lightweight side
review.name: Runs a little large, but good quality

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Size up, my son is a 7 and that was to small, not true to size. The top of sandal kind of impinges even when loosening the velcro. Have to pay for a label to return them. Ill gift them to my friends son hopefully they fit him
review.name: Size up

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is our second pair of these sandals.  Our Grandson out grew the first and asked for another pair.  They are his favorite sandals, I believe he will outgrow them before he can wear them out.
review.name: Best boy sandal

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Not having the adjustable back is great, a feature not really required for toddlers. Comfortable, very durable, and nice design.
review.name: Brilliant

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful and Comfortable, Beautiful and Comfortable, Beautiful and Comfortable.
review.name: Beautiful and Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Flexible,  sturdy,  comfortable for my 5yr old to wear for play
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: The quality of these sandals look great. We usually get my 4 year old's sandals a size smaller then his shoes and it has worked everytime until these. They were too small and we had to send them back. Bummed because they looked great.
review.name: Fit is slighly small

review.itemreviewed: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Fit as expected, easy on and off. Great durability for a rough little boy.
review.name: I buy these every summer for my grandson.

name: Techsun Vent Water Shoe - Little Boys'

review.itemreviewed: Gear Warrior XE 2 Wheeled Convertible Carry-On
review.reviewBody: I bought 2 of these for me and my daughter for a wandering month long trip where we didn't always have nice sidewalks to roll on. The wheels are super rugged. Everything is super sturdy. I've seen reviews that complained about the zippers being hard to move, but my 10 year old did fine on her own. Everything on these is overbuilt. It is surprisingly comfortable as a backpack. If you want a 4 wheel carry-on that rolls easy over nice smooth polished floors then this is not for you. If you want a rugged two wheel that rolls fine in the airport or in the dirt and can be worn as a backpack then this should be on your shortlist for sure. I also looked at the osprey hybrid rollers and the design was flawed in my opinion in that the telescoping handle took up way more space inside the bag. If you don't need all the space then that might not be an issue. The osprey bags were a little cheaper build quality, but I would not have worried about using them at all. As for these eagle creek bags, I highly reccomend.
review.name: Great versatile carry on

name: Gear Warrior XE 2 Wheeled Convertible Carry-On

review.reviewBody: Lite weight, fits perfect
review.name: My hat

review.reviewBody: Great design and fabric for many uses. The fabric is light, the brim is just the right width to provide shade, and the strap keeps my hat secure in the wind on the ground and in our convertible. Really appreciate that it comes in a small size, too. I loved my first one so much, I bought one in another color for traveling.
review.name: Light, versatile, packable

review.reviewBody: Cute hat, Light weight for the hot Hawaii weather, Good brim to protect from the sun.
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for a comfortable, yet cute sun hat. Something with more character than the typical, beige fishing hat. Love love the pink color & subtle embroidery that can be seen when you're closer up. Perfect amount of stability yet flop to the brim. I have a decent sized head (definitely not on the smaller end) so using the sizing guide helped to choose the medium size. It was accurate sizing. If it's too big, an elastic is available at the back of the head to tighten.
review.name: She's perfect.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very light weight, I use it during my trail runs and it doesn't fall off. Protects me from the harsh rays overall an excellent product swell made. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best hat ever!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a comfortable, yet cute sun hat. Something with more character than the typical, beige fishing hat. Love love the pink color & subtle embroidery that can be seen when you're closer up. Perfect amount of stability yet flop to the brim. I have a decent sized head (definitely not on the smaller end) so using the sizing guide helped to choose the medium size. It was accurate sizing. If it's too big, an elastic is available at the back of the head to tighten.
review.name: She's perfect.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and cool. I have 2 colors
review.name: Nice lightweight hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I burn easily and wanted a quality hat that would protect me from the sun and look good at the same time. This is perfect!
review.name: Exactly what I needed!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A functional sun hat the color of Utah's red rock desert (technically, the orange mineral in granite is feldspar, not quartz). It comes in different sizes and has both an adjustable elastic hat band and a chin strap so it stays on in the wind. Even my teenage daughter says it looks OK on me, so that's high praise.
review.name: Cute sun hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and lightweight. My partner kept stealing mine so I bought a new one in this great soft purple color. So useful when gardening, hiking, or paddleboarding.
review.name: Love the color and the fit and feel!

review.reviewBody: I ordered the color loam.  They arrived today; thus, I can't comment on how they hold up to wear and washing.  The color is close to the picture, maybe a little darker. So, it won't unravel. I'm so happy with these pants that I'm purchasing the other color.  I hope they are the same.

review.reviewBody: I have owned OR ski pants for the past 10+ years. Loved them. Unfortunately the Skytour AscentShell Bibs I recently purchased are the worst pair of ski pants/bibs I have ever owned. Fit: the top of the bib is very tight in the front and the suspenders create a weird gap that makes them very loose in the back. strange fit.  The bottom half/legs of the bibs are very loose. I bought a size  large (my pant size for OR) it almost seems like above the waist is a small/medium and the bottom is a large/xtra large. Thigh zipper pockets are no longer  longer water resistant. Fabric seems thin/low quality compared to a few years back. No belt loops (compared to other bibs), The pant cuffs are HUGE. There is a snap on the cuff to make them smaller, but it is difficult to "snap", they come undone easily, and make the HUGE cuffs look like an 1980's peg and roll when secured. (Very) Unfortunate that I thought these pants would be similar to the skytour pants  I have purchased in the past.
review.name: OR quality has gone downhill

name: Skytour AscentShell Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Acheté, livraison rapide et l’installation relativement facile extra
review.name: Super produit

review.reviewBody: This rack came pre-installed on our new Sprinter RV. I was skeptical that it would work with our matching Trek Verve 2 Disc Lowstep bikes as they don't have a top tube. I called Thule and they said they wouldn't work with the rack "as is" and recommended we purchase a bar that goes between the handlebar stem and the seat post. I tried to mount the bikes without the recommended bar anyway. I quickly realized the RV dealer assembled the rack incorrectly and had the clamps reversed.  I put them where they were supposed to go and had the bikes on in lest than five minutes!  We drove the RV two thousand miles to see the eclipse and the bikes held rock steady!  This is a great rack once you figure out where to secure the clamps on the bikes. I did need a step stool (17") to reach and secure the bikes. I'm 6'2" tall.  No big deal in my opinion considering how secure the bikes were on the rack.
review.name: Works great with Step Through Bikes (no top tube)

review.reviewBody: I saw some reviews complaining about the lack of written directions but after installing it myself on my 2022 Ram Promaster, the complaints were unfounded.  I had no problem following the picture diagrams and the install came out perfect.  My wife and I loaded the bikes on and took them locally for a ride to test it out.  The Thule rack is everything it said it was.  We love how secure the bikes are in the rack.  No movement and with the ingenious locking ability, we feel they will be secure from theft also.  I would recommend this bike rack 100%.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: We have been using our new bike rack for the last few weeks and WOW! We love it! It fits the van very well. I love how adjustable it is!
review.name: Sprinter Bike Rack

review.reviewBody: One key reason I bought this rack was to carry two bicycles on a trip of a life time to Alaska.  After arriving home after three months and 12,000 miles I found the rack had started to detach.  The adhesive was showing.  I removed the rack and found most of the adhesive was still sticking to the my van, but was no longer sticking to the rack.  My wife and I have spent over 3 hours just on the lower mount to remove the adhesive only to find the rack put lines in the van finish.  Looks like I'm going to have to have the door refinished too!  What a mess.  I wouldn't feel comfortable ever re-installing this rack on my van.
review.name: Didn't stay attached

review.reviewBody: Very recently installed this rack on our van. Very happy with the design and how it works. Would have been good to know sooner that an uncommon adhesive is required and not supplied. Would still buy this rack but there is no indication that an adhesive available in Europe or supposedly at an RV parts suppplier is required. Kind of jams up my last minute get it done before the trip style. All good I the end thanks to about an hour on the internet and another two hours at a couple of hardware stores in my small town. Thule, would be nice if you could suggest more North American and common solutions.
review.name: Great rack but shame about the silicone.

review.reviewBody: I bought this product because I was in need of space in my van. Easy to use, the bike or really stabile, they don't move. I need to use a stool to lock down because of the height of the van.
review.name: Elite van xt mb sprinter rack

review.reviewBody: I'm quite happy with the delivery from Backcountry as it was timely and everything in good order.  Assembly is not difficult but pictorial instructions are not done well.  The rack is solid and bikes are held firm. The biggest issue I have is the rack is so high on my Sprinter van that I need a ladder or platform to get the bikes up and to secure the braces to the frames.  The key locks are very difficult to reach. I bought a rear step mounted in the trailer hitch so I have something to step on, but it is still difficult.  Also, with the bikes off and the rack folded up, the lower bike rail is perfectly located to mash the back of my head when I close the back door while standing on the ground.  Even though I know this, I have still forgotten a couple time and smashed my head.  There is no way my wife could get the bikes on or off due to the height.  This is with the rack at the lowest location of the three positions shown in the installation manual.  It seems Thule could have provided a lower mounting position and I expect better from Thule.
review.name: Solid Rack but not Convenient to Use

review.reviewBody: I have this product on my Thor/Dodge RV Van. It's well built, but I can't figure out how to change the position of top bar, for my different style bikes, ie road, mountain and gravel. directions don't help and no videos to show you how to adjust. I have had to take top bar off and reinstall each different bike. Dumb. .Other than that you get your money's worth.
review.name: Good Value

review.reviewBody:
For a $600 bike rack, this thing falls a little short.  

First, on delivery, there was some loose hardware in the box separate from the bag of the rest.  It seems that Thule has some quality control problems.  One of the critical bolts is not the same size, and that's important because it has to go inside the top rail.  Unless it's user error, I'll have to cut it down or find a replacement.

Second, mounting the rack to a vehicle requires a few ounces of glue.  For $600, I would think a few ounces of glue would be included in the kit.  Going to the hardware store isn't the worst, but I'm surprised.

Once I get the glue and the right size bolt, then I can see how it works as a bike rack.
review.name: Falls short
comment: Hi Scott, curious to see if you got the Thule Elite Van XT bike rack mounted and how it's working out if so. Thanks for any insight you may have!

name: Elite Van XT

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a hiking and backpacking trip last in southern Utah. I needed something for sun protection and cooling features and this worked great.

It actually feels cooler than the REI Sahara hoodie by 2-3C, even though they're both the same weight. I think this shirt has better thermal conductivity. It also absorbs sweat faster which helps increase evaporation. You can check by dunking both shirts into a tub of water. I felt much more comfortable with this in 30-40C temperatures with high humidity. I can feel the difference under a helmet. 

It's more stretchy, and greater horizontally compared to vertically so you have to be careful not to stretch it too far in order to keep it's UPF protection so I wear a loose fitting size. The fabric isn't as durable as the REI Sahara, as it has more pilling after a few months of wearing 2-3 days a week. The wrists seem to be more stained. 

It has more facial coverage along the neck and side cheeks near the ear because it has a smaller opening for the face. It's a round opening so it sits fairly symmetrical compared to the REI Sahara which has an overlapping stitch at the neck that causes the hood to twist to one side. It doesn't have a drawstring but since the opening is smaller, the wind doesn't really blow it off, unlike the REI Sahara which needs it's drawstring to be cinched to resist the wind.

The only benefit of the REI Sahara is possibly greater sun protection from the side rear angle due to how the hood drapes, but less protection from the side front angle; cheaper price; higher durability.
review.name: Cooler than REI Sahara

review.reviewBody: I live in Florida and this shirt is great for being outdoors in the sun.
review.name: great sun shirt

review.reviewBody: And it does it well. 10/10 for the hood, the sleeves and the torso. Protects from the sun - just as it says it does.
review.name: It does the things it should do

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of different sun shirts as I live in a hot, sunny place and work outside. I was excited to try this one out, but I've found that it feels a decent bit hotter than the Astroman sun hoody (which is my favorite by far) or even the Echo sun hoody (a close runner up). The material just feels thicker on my skin, I get less of a breeze coming through, and I find myself wishing I had worn a different sun shirt. Good price though.
review.name: A little thicker than I'd like, but still a good sun shirt

review.reviewBody: This is a nice hoodie. It's a little thicker and heavier than the Echo, but that's also the point. It feels sturdier too. Shades nicely and cools well - don't feel hot. The fabric feel is great too.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: I wear the echo line of active wear when I'm working out of fishing. The level of cool I get from wearing the ActiveIce appearal is unlike anything I've tried before. It keeps me cool and I'm not sweating as much as I do with the echo fabric. It does come with the trade off of being a bit heavier than the echo and not as breathable feeling since it's a thicker fabric. I will choose to wear the echo fabric when it's a cooler day doing a lot of activity and the ActiveIce fabric when it's really sunny and warm.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: These are great for working out, hiking, walking, etc. in warm or cool weather.
review.name: Loves these shirts

review.reviewBody: The Active Ice Spectrum Sun Hoodie fits like a dream, with just the right amount of stretch to move with me without feeling restrictive. The hood on this hoodie is a game-changer. With a UPF 50 rating, this hoodie is like armor against harmful UV rays. Not only does it provide additional coverage for my neck and head, but it's also designed to stay put, even during high-intensity activities.
review.name: Active Ice Spectrum Sun Hoodie

review.reviewBody: Love this material, it makes your skin feel cooler even when in direct sunlight. I know this will be a great addition to spending long hours fishing on the boat this summer.
review.name: I will be buying another couple shirts

name: ActiveIce Spectrum Sun Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Not sure why the other review claim these are poor in performance, just not accurate. These tires perform excellent! I haven?t tested them in wet rock or heavy mud, but everywhere else they performed better than expected. Even when pushed past their limits they remain predictable. I am coming from Maxxis Ardents, an equally awesome tire but at a higher price. With 2.4?s in the front and 2.2?s in the rear they are excellent. Easily set up in my garage with hand tools and a crappy floor pump, first try with Revo sealant. My Scott Genius loves them. 

Do yourself a favor and buy them when you?re ready for new rubber. The price is unbeatable and they look/feel great.
review.name: Great tire at phenomenal price

name: Trail King Performance 27.5in Tire

review.reviewBody: Well rounded, solid, simple and adjustable. Runs a bit small, so order a half size up
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: This is my boot of choice. Everything about this boot is built for longevity and high performance riding. The shell has tons of extra abrasion resistant material to combat wear from binding straps and board edges while on the lift, has extra reinforcement on the back stay, and the cup at the heel keeps your highback from digging in and wearing holes in your boot. The Performance liner is slightly denser and more supportive than the Team liner in the Lashed boot giving it a longer lifespan. The sole also has a different foam than the Lashed which is better at absorbing impacts.
review.name: Long Lasting Performance

name: TM-2 Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Performance 9.2 Unicore Super EverDry Climbing Rope - 9.2mm
review.reviewBody:
Still new, but found this by chance after realizing 8.5-8.9 is too thin for me to get warm and fuzzies. Found the Grigri would slip more than I liked before locking. 

The performance 9.2 has the same weight as the edelrid Swift protect 8.9, is unicore, and unlike the Beal joker 9.1 has good reports of durability. so far it has a handful of pitches, but feeds super smooth and locks right away. No damage so far and surprised it hasn't pick up more dirt.
review.name: Light, durable, and perfect for lead sol

review.reviewBody: Easy to get the water bottle in and out from a variety of angles which is ideal
review.name: Good water bottle cage

review.reviewBody: Arundel Grypto bottle cage is light and well made. The cage has good grip and holds bottles securely, but not so tight it makes removal difficult. I'm confident I won't be losing bottles riding gravel. It doesn't look bulky and has a nice profile. Bottom line, it's a bottle cage that holds a water bottle.
review.name: Good grip

review.reviewBody:
Love the bright colors.  I got purple.  Almost has a "sculpture art" look when the bottle's not in it.  I had been looking for a water bottle holder where the bottle pops in and out easily with one hand while peddling.  (no brainer....I've been riding hundreds of miles every summer for 40+ years, and this is the first time I've had difficulty finding a SIMPLE & SECURE water bottle holder.  (new bike this year & regret letting my old water bottle holder go with the old bike donated to an inner city kids program)  
Seems the new trend is for side loading bottle holders and the one that the bike shop put on the new bike for me was a BEAR to get my bottle in & out of while I'm riding.  Downright dangerous.  Had to stop just to get a drink.  
The guys at the bike shop told me no-one uses water bottles anymore.  They use hydration paks on their waist or back with a tube.  I personally, hate the sweat that builds up under those water paks & I hate the way they make the water taste, and keeping mold out of those joints & tubes is challenging!  I can see the need if one is a racer, but not for this recreational rider.  
..When my squeeze bottle up front runs low, I stop & refill it from the insulated thermos of cool water that I keep in my rear bike bag.
This "Crypto-Cage" water bottle holder allows the bottle to pop in & out with one hand super easy while riding, and it securely holds the bottle in place with no wobble over the bumps.  
I must say it did give me sticker shock for a molded piece of plastic.  
However.....If you want an easily accessible but secure bike bottle holder, ignore the price and get this one.  It functions perfectly, looks kinda cool, and there's not much out there to choose from in this category.
review.name: GREAT

name: Grypto Cage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love thissss! It has stability and its durability is perfect! It gives me comfort to know I’m using something useful! Its portability and versatility is out of this world!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just love this little plate. The color is so pretty and I love that I can have foods with liquids and it not spill out. The plate is very sturdy and holds up well with heavier food items.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Passage Plate is a lightweight and durable camping plate designed for outdoor adventures. Made from BPA-free, food-grade polypropylene, it's both safe to use and easy to clean. The plate features a minimalist design with a deep rim to prevent spills and make it easier to handle food. Its compact size and stackable design make it convenient for packing and carrying in a backpack. Overall, the Sea to Summit Passage Plate is a practical choice for campers and backpackers seeking a reliable and functional dining solution in the wilderness.
review.name: Super light weight for hikers/campers!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sea to Summit Passage Plate is very light and made of resistant material. Perfect to take camping, the park, the beach and for any meal at home. I received this product for free from Influenster and Sea to Summit in exchange for my honest review.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So happy it's dishwasher safe! Easy to clean when you don't have a dishwasher, very easy to pack away in a bag or suitcase when traveling. It's heald up really well so far, but, I'll be testing that out on my next trip. It's sturdy and can hold a fair amount of food. I really enjoy it!

review.reviewBody: Best shorts I have ever owned. Comfortable and has back zip pocket.

review.reviewBody: They are nice shorts. It might have been my mistake for ordering a medium. These were super tight and unwearable. I returned them.
review.name: Tight Fit
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
I own both the Sense and the Cross 5´ shorts and they look and fit great. The Sense are more comfortable (inner lining, elastic waistband vs drawcords) and the fabric is more breathable. So, if you don’t carry much and run in a hot climate, spend a little more and get the sense.

J’ai les Sense et les Cross et les deux modèles sont beaux et agréables à porter pour courir. Les Sense par contre sont plus confortables au niveau du sous-vêtement interne, de la taille (élastique vs cordons) et le tissu est plus doux et respirants. Donc, si vous n’utilisez pas les shorts pour transporter des choses et que vous courez dans des températures plutôt chaudes, je pense que ça vaut la peine dépenser un peu plus our le modèle Sense.

Male 5´10 70 kg and the medium fit good. August 2024
review.name: Good but the Sense are better

review.reviewBody: Very light and soft shorts, it does not cause discomfort when exercising, and the length is perfect. I like it.
review.name: Soft and Light

review.reviewBody: Seems Salomon changed the design once again, although this time not as drastic. The older model was my favorite running shorts, then came the next gen a few years ago, and now this one. Although the changes are not as drastic, one main change is that these are even shorter, about 1.5 inches shorter than the last pair I bought about a year ago. Logos are larger and the waistband seems just slightly smaller (or maybe the black makes it seem smaller). These shorts are closer to a 3" short and I wish I had bought the 7" which might be closer to the original 5". Pictures show new shorts versus those purchased a year ago. Just seems like my Grande coffee keeps getting smaller. Just don't do it to shorts. If you list it as a 5" short, make it 5 inches. On the fence if I will return these. Pretty frustrating.
review.name: Keeps Changing for the Worse

review.reviewBody: I really like them great shorts fits and look good
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Very nice shorts, i use them for races, and they fit perfect
review.name: Best shorts

review.reviewBody: I like the shorts just didn’t realize only had a pocket in the rear which is useless for anything you don’t want to get sweaty. I have a similar pair from last year that at least has a small side pocket to put my car keys in. Hat is just fine, needed something to keep the sun off the noggin.
review.name: Shorts/hat

review.reviewBody: Good fit, comfortable for long run and good pocket placement and size
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: Size guide said medium. They fitted very tight. Sent them back. Material is good though.
review.name: Way too tight
comment:
Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.
Most of the adjustments we make to our products are based on feedback from our customers, so they are valuable to us.
We pass your message on to our designers so that they can take them into consideration in the development of our future products.
Thank you.

review.reviewBody: It's perfect, I love this parka! Im 5'1", 120 lb, and XS fits great. Perfect for Chicago winters.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: It is so warm, it is silky and soft and puffy. I love it.
review.name: I love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Was really excited to invest in a North Face jacket for the first time. For cold Montreal winters, I need something that will block out the chill and keep me warm while I'm outdoors. I've worn this jacket in -2 weather with layers underneath and still feel chilly, this jacket isn't going to last at all during the peak of winter. It's rated a "3" on their warm scale, which is insane. Is this jacket defective, or has North Face quality just gone down the drain? After spending $350+ on this, worst purchase of my life.
review.name: Super unhappy - don't purchase for winter wear

review.reviewBody: I love my new Hydrenalite Down Parka! It's warm and perfect for late fall into winter. I love the deep pockets and the hood is great. I'm very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Love my Hydrenalite Down Parka!

review.reviewBody: Not as puffy as in the picture, wristbands extremely uncomfortable too. Super flimsy, held it in one hand and my cheap coat I've had for years in the other and it felt like I was holding a shirt compared to the other.
review.name: Extremely light and thin

review.reviewBody: Long and warm for outside recess in Western NY with my class.
review.name: YES

review.reviewBody: It says 600 down but I don't think it is ligit because when I wear first time and go outside I didn't feel cozy enaf I return it
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: Just received this jacket today, very very happy with it. It's very light, simple but looks stylish.
review.name: I would by this product again!

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th North Face jacket and I love it. The quality is great, the color is always as pictured. I gave it 4 stars because this jacket runs large.
review.name: Great jacket, exactly as pictured

review.reviewBody: This jacket is extremely lightweight and VERY warm. However there is no way to tighten the hood. I am SO extremely disappointed in that aspect of this jacket. I was walking in windy conditions yesterday and I had to pull the hood around my face with my hands because it kept blowing back. Also the sleeves are short and I hate the feeling of the elastic wrists. There is always a gap between my gloves and my wrists exposing my skin. I really wish I had purchased the longer jacket instead of this one.
review.name: Disappointed in hood and wrists

These shorts give me the impression that they were designed by someone who has never talked to a woman. review.reviewBody: Not the best performance shoe if you are looking for anything specific. However, if you want one pair for all different tasks, this might be the one.
review.name: If you are looking for an all-rounder

review.reviewBody: I bought these 3 weeks ago and the stitching is already coming apart. They are so comfortable, a perfect shape! But I can see they will only last a few months and not be with resoling
review.name: Comfortable but falling apart after 3 wk

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month or so ago. Got a great deal with the memorial day sale and my first-time purchase discount. The shoe is made of great material and allows for precise toe placement, although the aggressive shape compared to my prior rock climbing shoes took some adjusting to.
review.name: Great overall shoe!

review.reviewBody: I bought this about 6 months ago now, and I've got nothing but good things to say for them. They've been awesome for sending everything from slab to overhung, and seem to still be holding up just fine. The inside does bleed a bit yellow onto the feet, but its nothing permanent and doesn't bother me. The pointed toe has really helped with precise footwork, and is super fun for finding footholds on very sheer slab routes. Overall this has been an amazing shoe thus far, and would definitely be something i'd recommend
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.reviewBody: I got to climb in these for the last few months. It's amazing how fast I could break into them. While being very precise, they offer a lot of comfort. The pre-molded heel fits my foot perfectly and feels quite secure on agressive hooking. This shoe is a great all-around. It might not be best for the gym climbing on problems with lots of volume climbing.
review.name: A great all around shoe

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! They are great for indoor and outdoor climbing. I would give them 5 stars but the quality has been a little inconsistent over the several pairs that I have had.
review.name: Awesome and comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: A Pre-order list for the Green Vegan Version of this shoe which is due out this Fall.  I'd like to get on that list; and maybe you would, too.
review.name: I wish Backcountry Would Create

review.reviewBody: I've been using these for indoor bouldering for a couple years, and they're absolutely amazing!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody:
I have these shoes for several month now. They are to the point where they will need their first resole. I use them exclusively indoor. 

Sizing/Comfort/Break-in:
Out of the box, they are very tight across the forefoot on me (I have very thick feet). I have Katanas and Miura VS in 39 and I don't recall a more painful break-in period. First 10 sessions or so I cannot wear them for more than one climb. Now they are fully broken in, I would consider these my all day comfort shoes. They feel 1/4 size looser than a pair of old 39 Miura VS; it could also be the more symmetrical last also. If you are used to Solutions, these feels shorter and wider even though they are build on the same last. These heels on these are also softer than Solutions and easier to get into. They are also a tad softer in the midsole than the Solutions (for what it is worth, the midsole on the Skwams are 0.1mm thinner).

Performance:
Most of the time, I can trust them on the tiniest foot holds (say 1/4" wide, quarter size). Even sized comfortably for me, I trust them completely on edging. You sacrifice a bit of comfort when edging compared to XS Edge rubber shoes, but they stick well. 
The half sole design make them very responsive on high feet where you have to dig in with the big toe and pull through with the feet. The rubber on top of the toe makes toe hook a breeze. You'd think the slit in the sole on the forefoot is a bit gimmicky, but it does help the shoes conform to volumes and slopers. The rubber on top of the toe makes toe hook a breeze. 

Longevity:
I have these for about 7 months and I climb on average two times a week with them. The outsole wore down to around 1/4 of its original thickness around the big toe area. I think this is decent for such a sticky rubber. However, I only climbed on plastic with these as I prefer a harder rubber outdoor.
review.name: Good all-arounder for me
comment: I agree with Dekun:  For such a soft shoe, the Skwamas edge surprisingly well; and you don't even have to size them like Geisha shoes to obtain that precision.  I use mine all the time at the gym and love them.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these as my second pair of rock shoes. I started on LS Finales and felt like I had outgrown them in terms of aggression, and I also wanted a more aggressive feeling fit. I had a 42.5 in the Finales, and I went down to a 41 in the Skwamas and the sizing has been perfect. When I was trying sizes on the 41.5 felt perfect, so I decided to go down half a size and I think it was the right decision. 

For their aggressive profile, they are honestly really comfy, 10/10 would recommend!
review.name: Love them!

name: Skwama Climbing Shoe
Skwama Climbing Shoe

hasVariant.name: Portal XL Goggles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Zeal Portal XL Goggles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The anti-fog on these is really good, I haven't had fogging issues with them this season.  Even with a mask on these haven't fogged up on me, and I found that I could leave them on in lift lines when it's snowing heavily.  My Smith I/O X goggles fogged up really badly with similar use (this is why I replaced them).  The lens change system makes lens changes really easy, and it feels secure.  I'm not sure if the description above says it or not, but it does come with a 2nd low light lens.
review.name: Good goggles, hard to fog up

review.reviewBody: So, I tried these side by side with the regular Zeal Portal goggles.  I have a very big head (typically need to wear size XL helmets, and hat shopping is a nightmare for me because everything is too small).  The Portal XL is slightly more concave than the Portal, meaning that, counter-intuitively, the XL fits better on a narrower face.  The goggle itself is slightly taller and wider (by a few mm), but again, "wider" meaning that it would wrap around further a narrower face.
review.name: XL doesn't mean for bigger heads

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in Dark Night/Alchemy Mirror, which shoes a minty-orange lens on the website. However, the actual product is more of a dark blue and pink lens. Just a headsup! Great goggles otherwise!
review.name: Incorrect Color Pictured

name: Portal XL Goggles

description: Buy the Smith Squad S Replacement Lens online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Squad S Replacement Lens
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Squad S Replacement Lens online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are the Squad S lenses as the product title says.  The photo is incorrect though - for example the tabs on the nose piece don't protrude like the do in the photo, they are actually cut into the lens similar the the top part of the photo.

They also ship unprotected in a plastic bag (this may be a Smith issue, not sure).  When I returned them they were processed as "used," which they were not, so possibly the packaging was an issue.  And the film on the interior side of the lens appeared to have been peeled off and replaced 
(air pockets everywhere) when I received them, so maybe that was an issue as well.  I received store credit but annoyed nonetheless that I shipped them back in the same condition I received them and was dinged for that.
review.name: Wrong Photo, Shipped Unprotected
comment: I'm sorry to hear about the issues with your lenses and the return process. I've sent you an email to look into this further and help resolve the situation. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

review.reviewBody: I want to buy the original lens on my squad s goggle but why I can’t? That is weird. Regular squad and squad xl both have the ChromaPop Sun Platinum Mirror Lens as a replacement. But why I can’t buy the same original lens for my aquas s goggle?
review.name: No original lens

name: Squad S Replacement Lens

description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool
review.reviewBody: Absolutely awesome  ride tool.  It could use a slightly better explanation of the double ended bits, but that is minor.
review.name: Fantastic

review.itemreviewed: EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool
review.reviewBody: Great in theory, but the magnets aren?t strong enough and are prone to coming loose. You have to buy an additional sleeve for the tool, which is already quite expensive, so it fits snug in your handlebars.  The bits are held in place by small O-Rings, which have a tendency to move, allowing the bits to fall out.  While out riding with a buddy, I handed the tool to him, he used it and returned it not knowing to slip the O-Ring back.  I didn?t check, which was my fault, but of course I lost a bit.  So now I?m out another 20 dollars to order replacements bits.  All in I have about $100 into this system, which is just not worth it.  The tool itself is well made, and great to use, I just stopped carrying it with me when I ride.  It now sits in my car as a backup.  Easier to just throw some hex wrenches in your jersey pocket and save yourself 90 bucks.
review.name: Meh

review.itemreviewed: EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool
review.reviewBody:
While WolfTooth claims these work in both flat and drop bars - don't take their word for it.  I've lost 3 different systems out of drop bars. Each time I increased the amount of extra o-rings and shrink wrap on them, trying to get them to fit tighter. The fact is, if you move them from one bike to another, they're going to keep getting looser and looser. Hit any small bump in the road and they're gone.

I'm out over $150 and now don't have any tools while I'm out on the road.
review.name: Not for drop bars

name: EnCase System Hex Bit Wrench Multi-Tool

review.reviewBody: Didn't like the way the bottom part hung down and rolled up. Quality seemed pretty good.
review.name: Other people like it, I'm sure

review.reviewBody: Finally a wicking performance running bra that is not all polyester. The fabric is super soft but still supportive. Yes, even the chest band at the bottom.
review.name: Super soft fabric

review.reviewBody: I ordered this because I really liked the fit of the previous style of this bra and hoped this would work despite the changes. However, they inexplicably added a ton of extra fabric which gaps at the top on my chest. So it just creates an awkward bulge when I wear a shirt over it. Then the band below the girls runs way too far down my torso. I suppose this would be fine for winter hikes but really wanted the option to wear year round under a shirt.  I ordered two of these and will be returning both.
review.name: I want the old version back

review.reviewBody: Very nice crash pad. It is a little bit hard for the purpose I purchased it for, but know I will get many years of use out of with my grandchildren.
review.name: Mad Rock crash pad

review.reviewBody: We built a rock wall in our garage and have since bought 2 pads, which are able to be attached together.  They are incredibly durable and provide protection from falls on top of a concrete garage floor.  Great product!
review.name: Great Climbing Pad

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a big pad that is suitable for highballs but still fits in my car and doesn?t cost a ton. The triple pad is it! It is massive and had 5? of sturdy foam that evens out rough terrain and easily breaks a fall from 20+ ft. I took a 23 ft fall onto the pad and was fine! It also packs up pretty well so it is manageable (it?s still big though). Another added benefit is that you can place your pack on top of the pad and secure it with a bungee for a simple way to haul your gear. I highly recommend it!
review.name: Great Big Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the SciCon Aerocomfort 3.0 TSA Road Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Same as Eric H. - American Airlines broke the seat stays after 1st leg of 1st trip with new bag. Had to rent a bike to salvage the week ($500) plus the additional insult of paying $80 in baggage fees for a bike I never got to use. $1k to repair the carbon. Expensive trip after paying for this expensive bag.

Don't assume the airlines will use the proper care for a soft sided bag OR TSA will reassemble a hard sided correctly. Also, mine was returned without the TSA lock (I assume they cut it off).
If I every travel with my bike again, I'll use a hard case and witness the TSA inspection (to insure it's repacked correctly).
review.name: Was so hopeful ...

name: Aerocomfort 3.0 TSA Road Case

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality garment that lives up to the price tag. It stays fresh even after a few wears and is perfect for travel. It does attract a lot of lint but the comfort and utility of this shirt outweighs that for me.
review.name: Thank you Sheep!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I buy this for my son- it's his favorite shirt. I buy one every year and it's his favorite gift. He wears it almost every day for work!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again and again!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shirts but sadly the consistency of the sizes was off, I received two smalls and one was significantly wider than the other. they also run long past the waist so I need to get them altered
review.name: Great shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been my go to shirt for everything from hanging out at home to walking, hiking and every kind of outdoor activity. A perfect blend of breathability, durability and warmth. Great value!
review.name: Perfect shirt for every activity

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought these in men's & women's for a 3 week trekking adventure. These shirts are awesome. You can easily rinse to freshen up when you have access to running water, they dry quickly and don't hold any funky smell, perfect for travel. We took 2 for each of us, so that one could be rinsed/dried and the other worn. Excellent purchase & worth the price. Weight is heavy enough to wear like a regular T (vs undershirt) but light enough to keep you cool on warm days & dry quickly when washed. Highly recommend.
review.name: Best T

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like it. It's become a T-shirt I look forward to wearing so I'm back for more!
review.name: Nice shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall the shirt will do what you are buying it for. It's not a fashion shirt that you will wear in daily life to look good. It's a shirt you will take on long term travel or doing outdoor adventures and it fits and looks like that. I will say it doesn't look bad, I would wear it out in town while traveling, but if you're looking for something that you'll wear to look good in daily this ain't it.
review.name: It's what you're expecting

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shirts are ultra comfortable and can be worn as an undershirt or a T-shirt, sporting attractive graphics.
review.name: Nice T-shirt and/or undershirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They fit like a classic T-shirt, don't wrinkle, itch or stink.
review.name: Best everyday & workout shirts!

name: Merino 150 Tech Lite Skiing Yeti T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Nordwand Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nordwand Pro Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Nordwand Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Amazing glove, very warm, grippy. The liner is a little loose inside. But overall a great.

Uses: Winter snowshoeing/hiking/scrambling at -5 to 10 C.

Warmth: These are very warm for my uses, which admittedly don't go as low-temp as what others might be using them for (ice climbing). At 0 C and above they be a little too warm during intense activity.

Fit: I got the 6" glove based on Mammut's size guide and they're perfect for my hand length just under 7". They're a bit of tight, but that makes them tactile when handling an ice axe and fiddling with crampons, snowshoes, etc.

Quality: So far so good. No glove really survives the torrential rains of the Cascades but for snowy days and light rain they have kept my hands dry. The leather has fantastic grip and the interior is comfortable all around.
review.name: Go-to gloves for winter adventures

review.reviewBody: The Nordwand Pro gloves keep me warm no matter what. I've pulled them on long ice climbs, backcountry split boarding, carving out snow pits, and I pull them out around town when temperatures hit -40. I really feel confident in knowing ill keep all my fingers every time the temps drop.
review.name: Solid Gloves

review.reviewBody:
Glove sizing is always a bit of a crap shoot, and the risk of being stuck with gloves that do not fit is high as there is no return/replacement policy. With that said, these fit great, like a glove, you might say! For reference, my palm to fingertip is 9", and my hand circumference is 8.5". I got a size 10

Things that stand out and that I like:

>The elastic cuff and velcro tab gets the gloves under the jacket sleeve. 
>They are not crazy bulky, you still have plenty of dexterity. I have used them with walking poles and ice axe without issue
>So far, they are hardwearing; the leather palms and fingers are standing up well
>They have a clip to secure them together and loops to hang them from a carabiner

All in all a great asset to have in your kit bag
review.name: Great Fit and Warmth!

review.reviewBody: Although the gloves provide excellent tactile and grip performance, they aren't very warm.
review.name: Mammut Nordwand Pro Glove - Excellent grip and feel, but not very warm

review.reviewBody: I've been ski touring in these gloves and they've been surprisingly warm, given their construction. I've had them down around -10C with no real comfort issues. I wouldn't hesitate to push them to about -15C touring, but much past there and they would probably be too cold for me. I am excited to climb some ice in them as well - the way they are constructed leads to phenomenal dexterity. Probably solid for moderate mixed as well, but for hard mixed climbing the leather on the palm is definitely too thick for my preference.
review.name: Warm and dextrous

review.reviewBody: These are the warmest gloves on the market. Great for keeping your hands warm in below freezing wind.
review.name: Warmest Gloves

review.reviewBody: I have used these gloves for 2 seasons now. Mostly I use them as my ice climbing glove, they are insulated just enough to keep my hands warm without limiting the dexterity while climbing. The leather palm takes lots of abuse handling ropes which I appreciate. I have very small hands and these are a unisex glove, I wear a size 6 in these gloves which is pretty close to a women's XS.
review.name: Great ice climbing glove

review.reviewBody: The gloves have great feel, but my fingertips get quite a bit colder than some of my other gloves.. I am primarily using the gloves for ski touring in the Wasatch and really enjoy when temps are above the mid 20's.. the gloves are very form fitting to the hand (I can see why ice climbers like).  Although I complain about my hands being cold, they continue to be a regular go-to glove.
review.name: Great dexterity and feel but sometimes chilly

review.reviewBody: I got this glove with the intention of using it for winter, ice and alpine climbing. It turned out great for it. I can comfortably belay with them on and without to much effort manage my rope system. They kept my hands relatively dry and have help up well over the course of one season.
review.name: Snug fit with great dexterity

name: Nordwand Pro Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for work boots, I'm a rough carpenter, lots of carrying heavy things and climbing around steep roofs.  They are adequate for the job, not anything special, but a good deal for the price.
review.name: That'll do

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Lowa perfected this design long before the plethora of new brands stared hitting the market a decade ago.  I just bought a brand new pair to replace the last pair of the same boots that I have owned for 12 years.  They could have lasted many more years if I hadn’t torn the stitching on a particularly sharp rock.  I have used them on multi day backpacking trips, climbing Cascade volcanos, or just trudging around the neighborhood park on dark, wet, winter evenings.  Equally comfy in all conditions.  Only downside is the feet can get very hot hiking in summer, as would be the case with any leather boot.
review.name: Best boots I have ever owned

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've long heard how amazing these boots are and finally picked up a pair for myself. I hiked several miles in the Smoky Mountains (lots of wet spots on the trail) and had zero issues. I did not break them in beyond just trying them on. The were extremely comfortable, protected my feet from rocks and roots, and kept them dry but not hot. My feet generally sweat a lot when hiking so I was worried about the waterproof/breathability factor. Gore-tex nails the ratio and my feet stayed dry without being too hot. 

One note/issue - there was a pressure point, likely from a seam, near my pinky toe on the right foot. However, it went away after the first couple miles and I have not experienced that since. 

Overall I'd recommend these boots to anyone of any skill level. I know they'll last a long long time due to the quality Lowa construction and reputable Vibram outsole. I can't wait to use them again!

Note on fit: the only other Lowa's I own are the Alpine Expert II's, which run big. I wear an 11 in those but 11.5 in the Renegade GTX (11.5 is my standard size).
review.name: Solid out of the box!

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My first pair of these boots kept me comfortable over 4 summers of hiking a couple dozen of Colorado 14ers.  Just did my first 15 mile hike in my new pair and they were fantastic.

I have very wide feet and a neuroma in one. Lowa are one of the only manufacturers of a high-quality boot in a wide model. Only boots I have found that don't make my neuroma scream.

I'll beat this second pair into the ground and then get a third pair. Highly recommend.
review.name: 2nd Pair - just as good as the first!

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for a up incoming climb. I will not be wearing these. Just walking around town my toes hurt bad. The soles push your feet forward. I tried everything from new insoles to lacing tricks no joy. My toes hurt now just sitting here typing this. Waste of money. Now I have to buy another set of boots. Geez! Do better Lowa!
review.name: Not Good!

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The cushion on the insole is very thin, and results in a hard feeling when hiking. Standing in like (Zion) sucked in these. But they are rugged and grippy. I have wide feet and I get blisters on the pinky toes as well, but I attribute that to my feet. Wide feet beware though
review.name: Rugged, but hard

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots have good padding and very good protection around my ankle's. The size was right on. I like the look of the boot also. The only thing I don't like are the thin insoles.
review.name: Nice and stiff

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The most comfortable boots I've ever owned.  Right out of the box and onto the track; no breaking in required.  I told my mate that if these boots lasted two years, I'd never look at anything else.

Now the "but": they lasted only a year.  Both boots have split where the upper meets the rubber right at little toe area - so, of course, they are no longer waterproof.  The stitching is also coming out of the leather band that wraps around the toes.  Both laces have also popped (of course laces pop but I would expect them to last a bit longer than that).

I still give four stars - and I'll still think about buying another pair - because I have absolutely hammered these boots over the course of the past year.  Many trips - often over rough terrain - and they have been constantly wet (the nature of tramping in NZ) and often haven't been given the chance to dry properly.

I'd really like these boots in a more indestructible version.
review.name: Very Comfortable But...

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
A caveat that I encountered is:  I am a size 11 across the board and with every manufacturer.   In hindsight, I should have ordered the 11.5.  

I am not knocking the brand, I just should have tried them on at a store before ordering.

I purchased these last fall and have just started wearing them.  There is a short break in so hold fast and you will be pleased.

Quality and functionality are the biggest features of this brand.  They have been manufacturing all level of foot wear for some of the greatest alpinists to the weekend hiker.  

Enjoy.
review.name: Lowa Quality - Tremendous Products

review.itemreviewed: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: If you see any, get them! They are a bit pricy but they are amazing. Someone gave a pair of these to me as a gift and they?re so comfortable and warm I forget to take them off sometimes even with thin nylon socks on outside. They keep your feet nice and warm but not too hot. Even in cold weather. My toes don?t freeze and hurt when I?m deer hunting anymore. Perfect arch support and you cant feel big jagged rocks under the hard soles at all so no more pressure points. Every step is like walking on a flat cushioned surface. 10/10. Worth every cent.
review.name: Best boots ive ever owned in my life!

name: Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Perfetto RoS Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Perfetto RoS Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are thin enough to allow operation of gears and grab your snacks without issues but I have used them in 42F weather and did not feel cold at all
The gloves are snug and comfortable 
Highly recommend
review.name: Light and great

review.reviewBody:
Several times I have worn these gloves down to 30F and even a little below and hands are comfortable. My hands start off on the cool side but after a few miles and the blood gets flowing things are toasty and stay toasty. I haven’t even broke out my heavier gloves at this point as these are more comfortable in the long run. I would think they are good down to about 25F actual temp but that might be their limit. Just don’t think they would be able to retain the warmth after that. 

They also held up well in a recent crash to my surprise. Just a little scrape on a knuckle. Replaced them the same day though as I don’t see not having these in my arsenal. Spectacular gloves!!! 

Gloves can be a little tight getting into at the cuff but besides that I’d say they might run slightly big. I’d love to go down a size to get arid of some extra finger length but don’t think I’d get in them.
review.name: Impressively Warm!!

review.reviewBody: Wore them today and had to turn around after 16 miles, it was around 40 degrees outside. After 8 miles I could not feel the handlebars and had a hard time shifting.  No insulation and going downhill I could feel the cold air.  Hope to be able to return them
review.name: Not Suited For Cold Weather

review.reviewBody: I can't recommend these gloves highly enough. I'm a big fan of anything Castelli. Over the years, my love has been tested a only a few times, most recently with their 'Spettacolo' gloves which were not, well, all that spectacular. The palm grip panels on that model sheared off after 2-3 rides, although they remain usable and have made the grade otherwise. The hyperbolic naming has continued with the Perfetto, but this time it rings true. I have ridden with these on several chilly rides, some with light rain and/or stiff headwinds. Despite being impossibly thin and light, they are quite warm-at least as warm as the heavier Spettacolo-maybe warmer, although temps haven't yet dipped below 40, when I usually reach for heavier gloves. The fit is nice and snug, so loss of dexterity is minimal when shifting, finding zipper pull-fobs, or poking around for a gel in the back pocket. Padding is grippy and substantial without being too bulky or obtrusive. Rain beads up and rolls right off, but I'm not sure that it would keep up with a real downpour. Most importantly, there is far less build-up of humid moisture in the inside, as you'd get with neoprene gloves that, in general, offer the best water resistance. Sizing chart is dead-on, but I have long-ish, skinny fingers. Even so, pulling these on (and especially off) takes some time. But, as with race-fit jerseys, etc., this is to be expected; they're not too small, just form-fitting. For reference, my hands, at their widest diameter: 8.75 in/222mm; index finger: 3 1/8 in/80mm; hand length from wrist crease to tip of index finger: 7.5 in/190mm.
review.name: Pretty Close to 'Perfetto'

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to use the gloves so ignore the stars. Based on other review comments about finger length, and the fact I have a long/slender hand, I sized down to L from my usual XL. However the fingers were too short and I had to return. So stick to your normal sizing. For reference my fingers are 8.5" from wrist to tip.
review.name: A note on sizing

review.reviewBody:
I bought these gloves for a fall and early winter riding (I live in Bend, OR). My hands get cold very easily, so I tend to need warmer gloves than almost anyone I've ridden with. I also specifically bought these due to the other reviews that mentioned long fingers, as I frequently run into problems with gloves where the finger length is a hair short for me. I would agree these a long - but great for me, and I'm sure it helps with the warmth!

My take is these are pretty outstanding. They are very thin for a winter glove. Yet, they seem to keep my hands warm down to at least 40F, and I've had them in conditions now where it was snowing (early and slightly wet snow, so probably 30-35 temps). 

The only thing to beware of is, that they do take activity and a few minutes to heat up. I believe this is due to being thin and that there isn't a "pile" or "fleece" or similar type of material on the inside that would trap ambient heat as much. But, basically as soon as you have been riding maybe 10 mins, they will be warm. They handle moisture great. I haven't had them in a full downpour, but have had mild rain, and snow as mentioned. I'm saying "true to size" because I think while the fingers are long, the overall fit is accurate for the size.

I've also found that they are likely going to be a great choice for AT skiing, when skinning up. Just used them for that the other day, and they were perfect!

All in all, these are a great addition to my quiver, and I really like the fit and function.
review.name: Great, especially for how thin they are

name: Perfetto RoS Glove - Men's

review.name: Best snowshoes in my opinion

review.reviewBody:
We are ready for the next season.
Due to weather, snow have been melt before we received our order…
review.name: Ready for the next season

review.reviewBody: These are by far the best show on the market for someone my weight (250 lbs)
review.name: These are by far the

review.reviewBody: I love everything about these snowshoes except the durability. First hike in the Adirondacks and the toe crampon bent. I bent it back, but they continue to bend on every hike. I had this exact same problem with my prior pair of MSR Lightning Ascents. At this price point, I expect better durability.
review.name: Great snowshoes but toe crampon is weak.

review.reviewBody: Got these for winter peak bagging and approaches in Utah. The traction is excellent even on ice and I love the heel bar for going up steep grades. Binding system is quick and easy. Frames feel plenty durable for my 200+ lbs plus pack weight. Look forward to many winter expeditions with them in the future.
review.name: Everything you could want in a snowshoe

review.reviewBody: I have three pairs of these in different sizes and they are absolute workhorses for pushing through deep snow. I use them for wildlife surveys in the boreal forest and arctic so they see a lot of miles through heavy snow with a ton of undersnow obstruction. I've only recently had to replace some of the crampon assemblies due to the straps wearing out. I had the old three strap system, and MSR hooked me up with those older sets since my cold weather boots don't fit into the Paragon bindings. Will definitely buy again when they finally break. Please offer the old three strap system as a purchasable option though!
review.name: Solid shoes

review.reviewBody: Shifted to these after using a parent product (Lightning Ascent Axis) and the harness has seen so much improvement. Comfortable and I feel like even in very cold conditions, it will be easy to put on. Still the loudest snowshoes on the snow, but grip and efficiency seem to come at that cost.
review.name: Shifted to these after using

review.reviewBody: Could not be happier with my new snowshoes, incredible product!
review.name: Lightning Ascent Snowshoes

review.reviewBody: Product arrived with fluid level less than the 1000 mL line even though advertised as 1000 mL.
review.name: Less than advertised volume

review.reviewBody: After buying about 4 of the smaller bottles over the past couple years, I realized it made a lot more sense to pony up and buy the 1L, even though I only do a full bleed every 6-9 months. Definitely a better economical choice, and you don't have to be as stingy with your bleeds as you do with the small bottles. As others have noted, this stuff works well and is the only thing I'd put in my XT brakes. One odd thing, however, is that this bottle was shipped with less than 1000ml in the container: I didn't see any signs of leakeage in the packaging, so am thinking this might be a common issue.
review.name: Go with the 1L

review.reviewBody: Bought the big jug so I always have it handy....mineral oil based brakes are the only choice for me...DOT fluid is not as user friendly.
review.name: All the mineral oil

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Ghost Shadow Hooded Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm, looks great, fits well. Great for winter.
review.name: Fits well

review.reviewBody: Beautifully designed and sewn down jacket w/hood. It's an alternative, for me, to a cashmere sweater, but with a hood and pockets!  So light weight, elegant looking for a down coat, warms me instantly over even a tee-shirt.  I travel with it packed small - but ready to pull out in planes, on windy days, etc. Great long sleeves, terrific option to have turtle neck "tight" top, hood stays in place. Love it - and hope the blue one comes back, too. (155 pounds, 5'7", LARGE)
review.name: Handsome, light weight warm jacket

review.reviewBody: I usually wear size medium in the Ghost down jacket. This was too small in the arms and shoulders. I wish it was more of an athletic shape. I returned it and ordered the large. But feels somewhat baggy
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: Bought this for warmth to weight ratio, has not disappointed and will be reaching for it often! Love the metallic blue color
review.name: Go-to hiking hoody + casual use

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket in the same size as my other Standard Fit women's jacket from Mountain Hardwear. The other jacket fits great; it is a comfortable looser fit that layers quite nicely. I could barely get this jacket on over my arms. It is incredibly tight in the bicep, upper back, and chest. I am a climber but not massively muscled by any means. I followed the size chart and given the perfect fit of my other jacket that is also labeled as standard fit, I expected better out of this jacket. Going to try reordering in a size up, but I am still hesitant that the arms will be too snug. Hopefully will leave a better review with the larger size as it seems like a lovely jacket and I love mountain hardwear! Would try the men's jacket for larger arms, but the hips never fit right on an assigned female at birth body.
review.name: Runs really small!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a layer under my ski jacket shell. With two base layer on and this jacket under my shell, I was still cold while skiing on a 20 degree day. I expected it to be warmer.
review.name: Great fit! Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these jackets about 4 years ago and I love it. Though the hood does not have a drawstring, it has been my experience that the way the jacket is constructed the hood stays in place when the jacket is fully zipped up. I recently bought a new one and it is very disappointing to see that the price has gone up quite a bit and they are cutting costs with inferior quality zippers and zipper pulls. My old jacket had rubber zipper pulls on all the zippers with thicker shock cord and the new one only has thin shock cord and no pulls. Within a few wears one fell out and I couldn't find it. Thankfully, I kept my old one and I replaced all the pulls on the new one. The colors don't match but I don't care. Too bad to see one of my beloved brands going on the cheap while still charging more for an inferior product. I still love this jacket and will keep it but will check other brands and rethink future purchases.
review.name: Inferior zipper and zipper pulls compared to my old one but higher $$$

review.reviewBody:
Pros: Lightweight, water resistant, comfortable.  Packs down tiny and great under a rain shell.  
Cons:  Hood  has no way to tighten and wind will blow off.  No chest or internal zip pocket.  Not  very warm… more like warmth of a thick wind resistant polar fleece.
review.name: Comfortable and light but hood has no adjustment

review.reviewBody: Lightweight down jacket that meets a need for a spring jacket to walk the dog, run errands and take on trips.  Love the color too!
review.name: Colorful light jacket

review.reviewBody: Awesome down jacket! I love the color and it is super lightweight. I am 5'6 and usually wear size 10/12, and the large is perfectly snug. The only thing is that the sleeves are a little too long, but not a deal breaker by any means
review.name: Go To Jacket!

name: Ghost Shadow Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this vest to replace the one I lost in Glacier National Park. I had my other vest for 5 years and wore it for almost all outdoor activities in cooler or cold weather. It is a light, warm layer with the great hood and neck coverage. Same great quality as my old vest.
review.name: Smartwool vest

review.reviewBody: Best fits nicely and is warm for cold runs. Has a hood that fits nicely if rain gets you while you are at. The rust color is a nice color.

review.reviewBody: I have wanted this vest for quite a while, and was so glad to find it on sale.  My feedback is the it is well made, a gorgeous color, and should last me forever.  However it runs VERY small.  I am 5'3, 130 pounds, and a solid medium in Eddie Bauer, LL Bean and other Smartwool tops.  I could barely get this Medium zipped.  I will be buying the Large, but beware that it is not true to size in any way.  If the Large is still too tight, I will be so sad.
review.name: Ridiculously Small!

review.reviewBody: This is hands down, one of my favorite vests. Not too heavy, not too light, perfect for any weather. You won't be dissapointed!
review.name: Absolutely amazing vest!!

review.reviewBody: Bought for indoor cycling. Nice stiff sole and wraps my foot nicely giving good support for upstrokes. Can be tightened more than needed creating a small hotspot on the top of the foot. Also slight extra sensation outer edge of ball of foot that didn’t have with my previous shoes. Overall very happy. Run SMALL! Sized up from my normal 39 and had to return for a 41 even.
review.name: Stiff with good wrap, runs small

review.reviewBody: I ride a lot of 3 hour rides and these shoes were comfortable from day one. They look great and it is super easy to adjust them during a ride (feet swell in heat) without stopping the bike. Really great for people with narrow heels and high arches.
review.name: Most comfortable bike shoe ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchase this thinking it would be a compact eating spoon, but it turned out to be too large. I chucked it in the trash after the first trip.
review.name: It's not a spoon, it's a ladle.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] if youve tried to not use something like this you know the pain.
review.name: folding, expanding, serving spoon. not an awkward, small, long, titaniam spoon

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have used this easy to pack spoon and the matching spatula on a 2 week bikepacking journey and it folds small enough to fit in my bowls. Really handy.
review.name: Handy Packing Spoon

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the folding spoon and spatula to replace our full-sized same. We are moving to a smaller van for camping and are downsizing all of our equipment. Very pleased with these. They seem strong and do the job with minimal size and weight.
review.name: Seems perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This work great for camping. Packs down to a perfect size, light and works great for our needs.
review.name: Packs down nicely

review.reviewBody: So far i really like this spoon! Guess I need to figure out where to get the matching spatula! One thing I can say bad about it is, that I can not read teh measuring graduates, But do you really need to measure anything if you are just pouring boiling water into a bag??
review.name: Can't read

review.reviewBody: I broke down and bought this spoon after being so impressed with the spatula with the same design. Sea to Summit has broken the code when it comes to foldable cooking utensils. Once unfolded, this spoon feels just a sturdy as anything found in the kitchen. The silicone bowl makes it easy to stir and ladle out meals. And I really don't thing Sea to Summit has emphasized how flat this spoon packs down. With the bowl of the spoon collapsed, it is about 1/2" thick. That is leaps and bounds ahead of ANY other cooking spoon I've ever tried. In fact, a cooking spoon was removed from my kitchen kit because they were all too big and bulky to be considered worth carrying. Finally, I can cook in the backcountry and not worry about flimsy utensils hampering the meal.
review.name: Camp Cuisine May Never Be the Same

name: Camp Kitchen Folding Serving Spoon
